It sounds like something broke in the process of removing guile and 
gtk and getting it to compile, since I have never heard of this 
happening with XOR.  Where did you download the code that is doing 
this?  Is it my version, or maybe the version Darren recently 
uploaded to the files section that compiles under Windows?

One thing you could do is comment out the depth call and just have 
the network activate some constant (e.g. 5) number of times.  It 
doesn't really need to compute depth to do XOR, or for continuous 
control experiments.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Everybody calls me Bull in real life" 
<robert_winkel@h...> wrote:
> I have the C++ version of NEAT, with the visualization and Guile 
> routines removed, and have successfully compiled it under Cygwin 
on 
> Windows XP.
> 
> When I run the XOR experiment, I come into a bit of trouble.  Most 
> of the time, it seems to get caught into an infinite loop and just 
> prints "** DEPTH NOT DETERMINED FOR NETWORK WITH LOOP" to the 
> screen.  Only once has this not happened, and has a xor_winner 
file 
> been generated.
> 
> I'm thinking that there must be something wrong with the 
NNode::depth
> () method.  Can anyone help me in this area?  Any ideas for 
> alternative code for this method?
> 
> Cheers,
> Robert.
